thread.title: People need to drive properly in roundabouts
thread.title_full: People need to drive properly in roundabouts

author: Contributed
title: People need to drive properly in roundabouts
text:
Browse > Home / Letters to the Editor / People need to drive properly in roundabouts People need to drive properly in roundabouts 
October 15, 2015 
By Contributed 
NEW — 11:46 a.m. Oct. 15, 2015 
I am a teenager soon to be in driver’s education, and I am concerned about the safety of the road Northeast 25th Street between Sahalee Way/228 th Avenue and 239th Place Northeast. 
My primary concern is the roundabouts and the concrete barriers that the city installed on the road. I know that they installed them to make the road a safer place, but unfortunately, they have only made the road even more dangerous. The problem is that the road is too narrow, and that people go through the roundabouts, instead of around. 
This has almost caused accidents, and if it hasn’t already, then it certainly will in the future. They also make it imposable for school buses to drop kid off close to their homes. We have to walk a mile or more to our houses, as opposed to two years ago, when it dropped everyone off within three minutes of walking distance. 
Brant Perkins 
Written by Contributed · Filed Under Letters to the Editor
